attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 18 March 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The physical stock count revealed minimal variances when compared with the system's recorded balance for almost all stock items. However, notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of +887 pieces.

ü  White Bread: Variance of +80 pieces.

ü  Brown Bread: Variance (21) Pieces.

ü  Wheat Bran: Variance of (1.05)

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·       Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.effect:
·       Most of the items show no variance, indicating that the system records align with physical stock.

·       The stock is the within the set limit, indication strong controls

value: The Wheat Bran and Bread variance is within the limit. The overall stock is okay.
Minimal variances. The controls will be strengthened even more.

·       In the previous Audit, the following variances were noted:

ü  Polybags +633

ü  Bread Stock

ü  White Bread – (17) Pcs

                   Brown Bread  +60
Previous
A stock take exercise was conducted on 18th March 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place i.e. Raw Materials, Finished Goods, Polybags & Miscellaneous.
Stock had minimal variances.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Strong Internal Controls are Put in Place.

attributes.title: Bread Weight Control & Compliance
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed on 19 March 2025 to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·       Dough Test was done 20 March 2025 to establish whether the set dividing ranges are followed.

·       From the selected sample, Bread Underweight were noted in

ü  800g Butter Toast : 47% overweight

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight in order to eliminate instances of underweight bread especially on 800g Butter Toast.
attributes.effect: Non-compliance with weights and measures regulations exposes the company to potential legal penalties, fines, or sanctions from regulatory authorities.
attributes.remediation_plan: Quality team to check on the quality of the 800g bread.

value:
Sample on 800g Bread will be done by the quality team and come up with a solution.

I will have a seat with the Oven Man and action will be taken to avoid this from happening again.
The 800g underweight bread was intentionally overbaked by the Oven Man to prevent shrinkage.

·       Few cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check. Minimal cases of underweight bread were noted.

·       Overweight breads were as follows.

      200g WB- 48%, and 600g Barrel

          W - 32%,
Previous
Bread Weight is done for all the varieties.

Compliance was met, with no cases of underweight bread on 200g & 400g Bread.

However, 800g bread had a higher case of underweights.
Operations/Production Department
To establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       We reviewed the damages for the period 1 to 28 February 2025 on 20 March 2025 to determine if there were instances of excess damages beyond the set standard limits of 0.25% of total production for production damages and 0.5% of total sales for market damages.

·       Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit as shown below;

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·       Branch management should monitor and control bread damage by ensuring that the bread produced meets standard quality, based on the branch’s production processes.
attributes.effect:
- Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

- No extra damages were converted to 400g loaves, indicating that damages did not significantly impact the overall production or sales.

value: We will improve and even reduce on damages.
We will improve & maintain strong controls.

·       Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.

-  Production Damage – 0.23%.

  - Market Damage – 0.21%
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
The production and market damages were within the set limit.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring controlled bread damages.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done for a period of 28 days from 1 February to 28 February 2025 on 19 March 2025 to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

·       An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.
attributes.recommendation:
- The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.

- We recommend the sales team to put more effort to bring more customers so that branch production capacity can be utilized.
attributes.effect: Average production was below set target of 144 bags. The 46.5% target achievement indicates that the branch is not meeting its production targets by 53.5%.

value: We will work toward achieving the set production target.
·       The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.

-  The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.

- We recommend the sales team to put more effort to bring more customers so that branch production capacity can be utilized.
Previous
Comparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 1st to 28th February 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System
Set Yield, Consumption was observed apart from set production target which was not achieved due to less orders and cutting down production.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved

attributes.title: Production Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
·       Production efficiency was calculated for a period of 28 days from 1February 2025 to 28 February 2025 on 20 March 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 5.0 bags.

·       The actual efficiency was 5.27 bags per worker, which was higher than the KPI.

A summary of the analysis is shown below;

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch should continue achieving the set production efficiency.
attributes.effect: The company saved KES 20,645 by achieving a higher production efficiency than initially planned (105% of the target). This suggests that the company's operations are becoming more streamlined and cost-effective.

value: The set production efficiency will be maintained.
Production efficiency is within the set standard we will maintain.
·       In the prior Audit, the production efficiency was 5.26 bags per production worker, which was above the set efficiency level.
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs. Standard production efficiency is 5bags per staff.
Production efficiency was attained.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is adhered to.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       Packing Efficiency was computed for period of 28 days from 1 February 2025 to 28 February 2025 on 20 March 2025 to determine whether the set company standard of 97 crates per slicer was being achieved.

·       The findings revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 96.28 crates per slicer.

The table below illustrates the findings;-
attributes.recommendation: ·     The branch should work towards achieving the set target of 97 Crates per Slicer.
attributes.effect: Failing to achieve the set target the company have incurred extract cost of Ksh.1, 824.

value: The efficiency was close to the set target. We will work towards achieving the target.
The efficiency is slightly below the target.
In the prior audit, Packaging efficiency was 96.49 crates per worker which was slightly below the target.
Previous

Get the total production for the 3shift of previous day, 1shift, and 2shift of the current day, then less FOC, Less Production damages, less oven damages and less deductions (short or bread)

=Loaves to be packed.
The slicing efficiency was close to the target.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure set efficiency of 97 crates per slicer is achieved.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description:
Findings:

·       A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 19 & 20 March 2025 to assess whether the operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

·       The physical quantities of various varieties were compared to the DDS balance, and the variance was calculated to identify any discrepancies.

·       It was noted that there were no variances between the physical quantities and the DDS balances for all the minishops i.e. Mtondia, Kilifi and Matsangoni Minishops.
attributes.recommendation: The company continues to follow strong reconciliation procedures between the physical counts and the DDS balances, to ensure ongoing accuracy and to catch any potential discrepancies early on.
attributes.effect: The consistency between physical stock and DDS data implies that the internal controls governing the stock counting and recording processes are effective.

value: Controls will be maintained
Controls are effective.
It was noted that there were no variances between the physical quantities and the DDS balances for all the minishops i.e. Kaloleni, Mtondia, Kilifi and Matsangoni Minishops.
Previous

Stock to be done on the 1st day of audit preferably before stock take.
 Loadings in the manager ‘s and guard’s book are compared with the STN used for loading the mini shop.
The controls were effective at Mtondia, Matsangoni and Mtondia Minishops.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the DDS balance reconciles with physical stock.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Findings

·       Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 18 March 2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to.

·       During the cash count, the variance noted was minimal  as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: The Cashier should maintain strong controls by doing daily reconciliations.
attributes.effect: The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: The positive trend will be maintained
To be maintained.
·       In the prior Audit, the variance was -25.36.
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 18/03/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage & Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption of the branch sales vehicle for the period from 1 February to 28 February 2025 done on 21 March 2025.

·       The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs.

On 13 March 2025, it was noted that the fuel consumption closely matches the established standard rate
attributes.recommendation: It is recommended to continue monitoring fuel consumption closely, as currently practiced, and to analyze the factors contributing to the positive variance noted
attributes.effect: Higher actual efficiency to set standard implies effective controls.

value: To be maintained
Fuel consumption is closely monitored daily to ensure adherence to the set standards, demonstrating effective control.
·       In the previous audit findings, it was noted that fuel consumption at the branch was within the set standards except KDH 543N that had a variance of-1.14KM/L
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Effective fuel consumption
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Fuel consumption tests were carried out on 18 March 2025 to determine if set consumption standards for generator was adhered to. Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 28l/hr.

·       It was noted that the consumption rate of the generator was 19.21l/hr.

·       Summarized generator fuel consumption from February 1 to 28February, 2025 is analyzed on the below table.
attributes.recommendation: It's essential to track the generator's average fuel consumption regularly and compare it with standard fuel consumption.
attributes.effect: The generator consumption was within the set standards. The 19.21 liters per hour is lower than the expected rate, it indicates fuel savings

value:
The saving is as a result one of the generators is not in use and another one is partially used.

        Effective controls will be maintained
The generator is saving since one of the oven machines is partially used in bread production.
In the prior Audit, the Generator consumption rate was 21.62l/hr
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption was economical.
The consumption rate was slightly above the set standard rate.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring generator fuel is fully utilized.
